questions.question: What kind of committee would most likely be formed to work out a compromise bill?

choices.answer: standing committee

questions.question: President leaves a bill on his desk for 10 days without signing it while Congress is in session

choices.answer: the bill becomes a law
the bill has been vetoed

questions.question: A member of the Senate must be

choices.answer: have been born in the United States
be over 35 years old
have first been a representative in the House
have been a U.S. citizen at least 9 years

questions.question: Congress determines how the seats in the House are to be apportioned

choices.answer: every 10 years after the census
every 3 years after the census
based on voter turnout in the previous election
based on the number of Republicans and Democrats in office

questions.question: Regular elections for members of the House of Representatives are held

choices.answer: in January of odd-numbered years
in November of even-numbered years

in November of each odd-numbered year

a U.S. citizen for at least 7 years
